      given a set of variables "S" a factor \phi and a bound "B", performs the following operation: sum_S (\phi * B) = {sum_S \phi \phi' : \phi' in B}

    • Uses of Bound in IncrementalAnytimeExactBeliefPropagation

      Methods in IncrementalAnytimeExactBeliefPropagation that return Bound 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Bound IncrementalAnytimeBeliefPropagationWithSeparatorConditioning.expandAndComputeInference() 
      Bound IncrementalAnytimeBeliefPropagationWithSeparatorConditioning.expandAndComputeInferenceByRebuildingPartitionTree() 
      Bound IncrementalAnytimeBeliefPropagationWithSeparatorConditioning.inference() 
      Bound IncrementalAnytimeBeliefPropagationWithSeparatorConditioning.inferenceOverEntireModel()
      from here the code corresponds to anytimeBeliefPropagation (re-do partitioning each time) PROS: MUCH easier to understand! Splits the process of expanding the graph from the one of defining a partition tree of the graph (DECIDING THE OPTIMAL PARTITION TREE IS NP HARD, SO IT MAKES COMPLETE SENSE TO SEPARATE THOSE TWO PROCESSES) CONS: If the implementation of both the Partition Tree and the Expansion of the graph s done with a BFS (which is the current solution) it becomes less costly to profit from the already built Partition Tree (that is to use the IncrementalVesion).
